alert.note: Alert for Avery; Buncombe; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Eastern McDowell; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 3:47AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MCDOWELL...MITCHELL... NORTHWESTERN CALDWELL...AVERY...EASTERN BUNCOMBE...YANCEY AND NORTHWESTERN BURKE COUNTIES UNTIL 415 AM EDT... At 347 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Deep Gap to 4 miles south of Beech Mountain to 5 miles southeast of Burnsville to 15 miles east of Downtown Asheville, and moving northwest at 5 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Marion, Spruce Pine, Burnsville, Newland, Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Old Fort, Banner Elk, Elk Park and Bakersville. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Buncombe; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Eastern McDowell; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey
